website_summaries.verdict: Polk Audio's Nue Era balances out rich lows with crispness and brightness in the mids and highs, but these earphones occasionally have some distortion issues.
pros: Crisp, balanced audio performance at moderate-to-reasonably loud volumes
Visually appealing design also offers secure fit
Inline remote control and microphone for mobile devices
Comes with multiple ear tip options
cons: Distorts on some tracks with intense sub-bass content at high volumes

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound, I never knew what I was missing all this time....
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sound, I never knew what it was that I had been missing all these years.. Always thinking how can there be much difference in those little earbuds, and their technology.. Let me tell you I just open pandora's box I'm afraid as I might just start looking up the ladder of techno magic just to see what else there is out there for me to find... My extreme complements, and thanks to Polk, and to their engineering department....! I'm extremely empressed ....!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Zachary E. Mohrmann

customer_reviews.title: and they work excellent. These headphones first caught my eye as I ...
customer_reviews.text: The first pair of Polks that I ordered were defective as the right ear piece didn't work at all. Thanks to Amazon, my son had his Birthday present replaced within days, and they work excellent. These headphones first caught my eye as I as reading Consumer Reports, and they rate them at the top along with another great brand that costs $350. I have other Polk products and love the sound that is produced. These headphones are no different. The sound quality is superb. Thanks Polk, and thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: mgrynder

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones but not the sound that I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace my worn out Klipsch S4i headphones based on the rating by Consumer Reports. These Polk headphones have a good sound but the dynamic range and the overall volume are noticeably inferior to the Klipsch sound that I was accustomed to. I bought a new pair of Klipsch S4i and these Polk headphones will wind up in a drawer. Others may prefer the Polk sound but I was left disappointed so I reverted to Klipsch.
customer_reviews.author: J. Eimen

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Loved this product so far. Great clarity when talking on my cell phone. Test: Walked on a busy street on a windy day talking with my elderly father that is slightly hard of hearing. Didn't mention to my father that I was on headphones but asked if he could hear me ok. He not only said yes but said I was clearer then ever before on my phone. Had no background noise I sounded crystal clear. After that - I was convinced that this product was a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: pamvlm

customer_reviews.title: For some dumb reason I didn't think it made much difference with ...
customer_reviews.text: I was always buying the cheapest ear phones I could find and didn't realize what I was missing until I finally decided to "upgrade" a bit. For some dumb reason I didn't think it made much difference with ear phones. I was very wrong. They're also so much more comfortable in the ear. Should've upgraded my ear phones many years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sound rivals a home theater
customer_reviews.text: These earphones were rated very highly by consumer reports, which is why I bought them to begin with. The sounds is excellent and although you don't get the surround sound experience like you do with a home theater, the audio is extremely well balanced and full. Comes with six different ear buds so you should have no trouble finding the right ones to fit your ears. Also some with a little cotton carrying pouch. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 would recommend
customer_reviews.text: This headphones honestly sound amazing. I had klipsch s4i headphones and I just wanted to buy a new pair of headphones to compare. The noise isolation is actually amazing. You cannot hear the sound of the engine during air travel. The sound is nice and rich with an good sounding bass for the headphone size.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Very good sound. Comfortable and secure fit
customer_reviews.text: Sound Great! Got a fantastic deal on an open box set. Sound as good as the Klipsch S4's that I accidently left on a plane. Not quite a detailed as my Shure E4C's but for $25 they were a steal. The design fits my ears well and they are very stable and comfortable even when exercising.
customer_reviews.author: R. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Sound clearer than a bell
customer_reviews.text: I first heard about these ear buds by reading about them in a leading consumer magazine. I was very satisfied as the sound was much better than the decent pair I got of a different brand at a Warehouse Club store. The highs are very crisp and may be too much for some tastes but I LOVE IT.
customer_reviews.author: Raisemore

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones smooth sound
customer_reviews.text: The sound is smooth on the headphones and Polk's audio customer service was great when i had to send back the headphones for malfuntion. They replaced it without asking any questions.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Area

customer_reviews.title: Polk Audio
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and comfort but you can't raise or lower the volume with them
customer_reviews.author: shawn crapser

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds are comfortable, and well made. my only feedback is the left earbud goes out sometimes. I'm in the process of contacting the company to resolve the issues.
customer_reviews.author: jrabbit

customer_reviews.title: So much for running...
customer_reviews.text: They send several ear pads with the headphones but none really fit my ear. The call quality is excellent, however, and the sound (when I can get them to stay in my ear) is good, too. There's one unfortunate thing about the ear pads: when they're firmly in my ear, I can hear the cord rubbing and bumping. Unless I'm completely still and don't move the cord, the resulting sound is really distracting. So much for running with these earbuds...
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: NICE headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, comfortable fit with optional sizes in earplugs. Just love these, especially on airplanes! I am so glad I bought these. BTW, I like classical and jazz, and musicals. Works great for those. Don't know about rock.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ingster

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound and fit. Flimsy cord gave up the ghost.
customer_reviews.text: Nice balanced, effortless sound. Found the perfect fit with the various included tip sizes. One reviewer noted what appeared to be flimsy cord construction. I've had them a whopping 6 months and the right wire went out yesterday at the gym. I know the cord is the weak spot of headphones, but usually expect them to last at least a year.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: It is not all about appearences,  BIG disapointment .
customer_reviews.text: These Nue Era Headphones, have wonderful packaging. Look like an Apple product. BUT the sound is shallow and tinny like any other cheap earphone. They look cool, but save your money. If i was the type, i would return this product!!! Keep shopping for something with killer sound.. forget the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: klix works

customer_reviews.title: you are much better off sticking with the standard Apple earbuds (around $30)
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I wanted earbuds with higher sound quality than the ones that came with my iPhone. I found them to be uncomfortable (they came with a bunch of different earbud covers, but none of them worked for my small ears), the sound quality is tinny and flat (with bass tones the exception to this), and the right ear bud stopped working after a little over 2 months of use. At this price point, you are much better off sticking with the standard Apple earbuds (around $30).
customer_reviews.author: Emmy

customer_reviews.title: no isolation
customer_reviews.text: Very good sound balance and sound quality but even at low volumes everyone knows exactly what I am listening to. For the money there should be better isolation. Still they work great for home use.
customer_reviews.author: JTB

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wiring a bit on the fragile side; connection on left earbud crackling.
customer_reviews.author: StoneTW9

customer_reviews.title: Excellent  high and mid range, decent base.
customer_reviews.text: If you're not a base fanatic, or mainly listen to classical music or acoustic guitar, these are top notch.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Panzardi

customer_reviews.title: Definitely block out noise
customer_reviews.text: Bought this set of headphones for my husband's birthday. When he opened them he had to try them out right away, but I didn't realize he was trying them out. I asked him a question and then again and no answer. When he walked in the room I asked again and he mouthed that he couldn't hear me. I guess the headphones do their job. :) He absolutely loves them!
customer_reviews.author: Rachael A Benge

customer_reviews.title: Great for workouts!
customer_reviews.text: Got these after I needed replacements. Did the ratings research and found my best price on Amazon. Several ear pieces are included. They fit well and do not fall out. The sound is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality was excellent but comfort was not the best
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality was excellent but comfort was not the best. And when we lost an ear tip, we couldn't find a way to buy replacements. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Chele Hipp

customer_reviews.title: Great but didn't fit me
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are fantastic, great balanced sound, but they wouldn't fit my ears properly meaning i couldn't get a proper seal and the bass response was horrible when i didn't get a good seal.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Terrible hissing noise, not existant customer service
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, the left earbud had a terrible hissing sound anytime music was playing. Tried to return the headphones but Polk Audio never emailed me back. The side that wasn't hissing didn't even sound that great. Spring for a pair of Grados or Shure!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: got it fast. item as described.very happy with purchase. thanks again!
customer_reviews.author: Robert T. Toma

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this purchase. It was delivered right on time. Consumer reports highly rated these earphones and they fully lived up to all my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Steve San Diego

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 15 months.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these in July 2015 for $57. After 15 months of relatively light, gentle use, they no longer work. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Hays

customer_reviews.title: went bad after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: great sound but 1 speaker went bad on me about 2 months after purchase. guess i'll have to deal w polk to get it replaced???
customer_reviews.author: James G. Bodin

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love them but....
customer_reviews.text: These Polk audio ear buds where recommended by Consumer Reports but, unfortunately broke within 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Worth the difference?
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a quality product. I tried shifting back and forth between the Samsung 4 earphones that came with my phone and the Polk audio headphones. The Polk headphones are definitely better (I was only interested in testing them with music.) Noticeably better bass response in particular. I just question whether the improvement was worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: lbins

customer_reviews.title: polk audio nue era headphones
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend it to anyone regardless of price I have others that cost more but dont sound better. Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: mike2jms

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound quality
customer_reviews.text: these things are well worth the money and sound better than much more expensive sets. The bass is powerful and volume levels are very good. If your looking for a high quality pair of headphones for less than 100 dollars, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect earbuds for me, only disappointment was that they have stopped making this type of earbud. :0(
customer_reviews.author: Brendan W.

customer_reviews.title: they have been producing great song on all of my songs
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones about 2 months ago, and not only are they still working perfectly, which is uncommon for me, they have been producing great song on all of my songs. I would completely recommend these to anyone who enjoys listening to music.
customer_reviews.author: jeff richardson

customer_reviews.title: VERY disappointed. According to Amazon
customer_reviews.text: The right ear speaker quit working one month after purchasing. VERY disappointed. According to Amazon, I am not able to return or replace this item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Purchased in Dec 2014 for my son. The right ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in Dec 2014 for my son. The right earbud recently stopped working and it's past Amazon's 30 day return policy.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds for jazz & classical music
customer_reviews.text: Sound is full on both classical music and jazz. Buds fit ears comfortably with several bud covers for different size ear canals. I don't use iPod for exercise, so I do not know how well they would work in that settig
customer_reviews.author: James E. Gumaer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound!
customer_reviews.text: The Polk headphones sound great! Very clear, good imaging and solid bass. These sound more like Shure multi-driver headphones in the $300 plus range. So far I've used them with an iPod Nano, a SanDisk Clip and my Samsung Galaxy Note II phone (for listening to music). I haven't run with them yet, so I can't comment about fit during exercise. For reference, I also own Sony, Klipsch and Etymotic Research headphones. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: SpikePC

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent audio quality but shoddy hardware. Left ear quit working less than two months in.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Work well to reduce airplane noise enabling better hearing of audio during flight.
customer_reviews.author: reticent farmer's wife

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These have good sound, good fit, and good ambient sound deadening. They suit my purpose well.
customer_reviews.author: Roger L. Greene

customer_reviews.title: Great sound . . . poor foam bud attachment design
customer_reviews.text: The sound is great when you have the right buds attached. Great noise cancellation. I bought these in the airport before a flight. I could not even hear the flight attendant. I immediately ordered them for a gift when I landed. However, over the 2 months, I have lost 4 buds from the stem - never to be found. It comes with lots of sizes of foam bud attachments and you will need them, but they won't all fit as well unfortunately. There is a design flaw. What a bummer. The sound was great.
customer_reviews.author: ARF

customer_reviews.title: ... by Consumer Reports and was looking forward to some great sound. However the sound quality was clearly not ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these based on ratings by Consumer Reports and was looking forward to some great sound. However the sound quality was clearly not as good as my AKG Q350 ear buds. Combined with the fact that they did not stay in my ears, I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Linda J.

customer_reviews.title: Spent $60. 00 on these only to have them ...
customer_reviews.text: Spent $60.00 on these only to have them break less then 4 months later.
customer_reviews.author: ATC520

customer_reviews.title: Skip these!
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing buds. Sound lacks bass depth badly. After limited use, they are developing distortion in right bud. If I still had the packaging, I would return them.
customer_reviews.author: KCM

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound
customer_reviews.text: These headphones distort at average volume level. They look great but they provide very poor sound, especially when you consider their cost.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not very good earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I returned these earbuds. The sound was very tinny and the cord was too short. The earbuds that come with the IPhone have a much better sound.
customer_reviews.author: Billy D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing sound
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought the headphones because of their high rating in Consumer Reports. However, after receiving and listening to them, I could tell no difference in sound quality from the ones which came free with my IPHONE 5. Not bad sound, but expected more.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound, Difficult Fit
customer_reviews.text: The Polk Audio AM4110-A Nue Era Headphones are nice. They have wonderful sound quality. A very balanced tone overall. But the headphones didn't fit my ears very well. They do come with many ear pieces so I may need to try more to find the right fit.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Pizzini

customer_reviews.title: over rated
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these on the recommendation of consumers reports. I am very disappointed in the sound quality. They fit my ears well and were comfortable, but I thought they sounded tinny. In my opinion, my free ear buds that came with my iPod sound much better. I am sending them back.
customer_reviews.author: R. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I had these head phones for a little over a month before the right ear bud broke. It now makes a static sound so loud I can still hear it with it hanging around my neck. As far as I'm concerned thats money down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: So Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: After only six months, I'm getting no sound from the left bud. I was pleased with the sound quality, but am so disappointed in the durability of this product.
customer_reviews.author: A. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Well...
customer_reviews.text: The voice is okay... But I would not choose it compares to its price. The product looks good though. It's Okay.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: ... for ear buds with a big base sound just like beats on the ear head phones
customer_reviews.text: at the end of the day I was looking for ear buds with a big base sound just like beats on the ear head phones. After several different earbuds I realized it couldn't be done. At least not under $100.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher S. Lamus

customer_reviews.title: Flying to Europe next week will be a good test.
customer_reviews.text: I have only just tried them. Flying to Europe next week will be a good test.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: My mistake
customer_reviews.text: They are no better than a pair of cheap skull candy oh and the first pair I returned immediately because the left ear bud was blown
customer_reviews.author: Linwood Jordan Jr

customer_reviews.title: sound is no better then headphones I have purchased for half the price
customer_reviews.text: Uncomfortable, heavy, doesn't sit in ear well, sound is no better then headphones I have purchased for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ebiker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite wired headphones for the iPhone/iPad. Sound quality is excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas F. Nieske

product_meta.title: Polk Audio AM4110-A Nue Era Headphones - Black/Silver
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Product Packaging:Standard Packaging


POLK NUE ERA IN-EAR HEADPHONES
Their design is fresh, a new approach to the headphone as a serious audio accessory. Nue Era are for anyone who cares about personal style, attention to detail. And the sound comes from more than four decades crafting quality audio products. It’s a sound that’s rich and immersive. But then that’s exactly the Polk style.

The headphone’s color palette complements today’s most popular champagne color schemes. Nue Era has an easy-to-use 3-button control and built-in microphone. The control is contoured to fit your finger for intuitive audio and phone control. Polk does audio. 40 years of knowledge creates the best headphone experience by far.Polk, world-renowned for its sound quality since 1972, started with a high performance 5.5 mm dynamic driver that exceeded previous drivers we had used in other designs. These drivers were developed with our Dynamic Balance driver design process that uses the variables of materials technology and diaphragm geometry to discover the optimum balance for the drivers’ performance goals.
feature_bullets: Nue Era's small, sculpted housing, made of a polymer resin chosen for its excellent audio damping properties, has been shaped especially with t and comfort in mind
We include different sized and shaped ear tips; they're made of supple materials that enhance their passive noise isolation. Together, housing and ear tips create an easy, effortless fit

Our ear tips also contribute to the rich, full sound. They're co-molded to the headphone ear tube; the ear tip opening holds its shape, which gives you better sound and a better seal for noise isolation
Nue Era has an easy-to-use 3-button control and built-in microphone. The control is contoured to fit your finger for intuitive audio and phone control
A single, lightweight cable connects headphones to supported iOS devices. A Y-junction lets you adjust the cable to your needs and reduces annoying micro-phonics

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars118 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
